title: Am I the only one who can imagine the hell of life if J.K Rowling had a trans daughter? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think she’s quite entitled to her opinion right or wrong. But maybe if she had a ‘trans’ daughter or ‘tran’s son then she might understand more if she doesn’t now. I did read what she said and I wonder if she just put her foot in it and didn’t bring her brain into gear before she commented. It does happen. I’m a ‘trans’ woman (had surgery many decades ago now so don’t even remember what it was like to be a ‘boy’ in my teenage years. I’ve been a mental health counsellor and worked with women’s groups and I never had any trouble relating to women as my brain is female. I’ve worked with ‘trans’ women and men and they are people like I’m a person. I would not want to invade anyone’s space be it men or women’s exclusive spaces if I was not wanted. I don’t find it a big deal as I just get on with my own life. I’m married to a lovely cis gender heterosexual man who sees me only as a woman not a ‘trans’ woman. We’ve been together for over 32 years now - I’m 72 by the way so now a ‘geriatric’ ‘trans’ woman. I can understand women being worried that men who still have penises going into women’s spaces if they feel vulnerable rape and violence. I’ve been raped and beaten in my life by a men and they didn’t know I was a ‘trans’ woman either. This was before I met my husband. But I know what it’s like to be fearful of men after what happened to me but thankfully I got over it in time. I don’t know Ms Rowling's personally of course but seen a couple of the films of her books and enjoyed them for fun.

It’s hard to ever be certain about things that will never happen. It’s possible that the experience would have made her more accepting than she is now. Maybe having her as a mother would be great. Perhaps she would be really helpful with financial needs. Perhaps being her child would offer some level of protection against discrimination as well. Perhaps she would have been an advocate for the trans community. Perhaps she would have created a foundation that provided support to trans people. It might not be hell at all. It could have been great for both her and the trans community in general.

I think it’s quite clear from her statements that JK doesn’t seem to have any trans friends. If she did, she’d have learned from her friends who life was like for trans people and understood that her fears are misplaced. If a family member came out as trans, it would give her the chance to learn.
